Name: Isis lactans statuette
Description: Statuette representing the goddess Isis, seated, with her son Horus on her knees. She is wearing a long ankle-length tunic and on her head is a crown which is adorned with two horns and the solar disc. On her forehead is the uraeus. The hair ornaments,  the collar and the armlets on the forearms are indicated by means of incisions. Horus appears naked, complete with youth lock, uraeus on the forehead and collar on the breast.
